meaningMnemonic: When <kanji>writing</kanji> just happens to "<kanji>fall</kanji>" on the wall (whoops, wasn't me who did that, how strannnnge) it's writing that's not supposed to be where it is. This kind of writing is <vocabulary>graffiti</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. 書, however, is kun'yomi in this case and also has rendaku. So just remember that it's read as が for this vocab and you'll be fine.
